update.description:
This pull request makes it possible to:

* Align nested models 

* Align a mix of nested models and links, respecting selection order

* Sync selecting nested models in the 3D scene, model tree and schematic view:

    * Note that on the schematic view the nested models are broken into links, so some tricks were needed to make that work.

    * Without this fix, selecting a nested link in the schematic view also selects it in the 3d scene which opens way for it to be manipulated, we don't want that.

* Any combination of selecting links, joints and nested models, each selection coming from a different widget, including multi-select holding `Ctrl`, should work.

![syncselect.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2664015414-syncselect.png)

I started writing integration tests for all of these but they can become very involved. So taking into account that many of these details might be changed due to user feedback, I thought we could just fix the issues now and write proper tests later.


[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/378/#showFailuresLink) didn't complain

[trusty nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/356/#showFailuresLink) didn't complain
update.title: Model Editor: Select and align nested models

content.raw:
Not sure if this is intended:

1. Click on double pendulum in 3D view and see that 3 nodes are now selected in the SV. 

1. Ctrl + Click on one of the selected nodes in SV and it becomes deselected - I was expecting this to deselect all 3 nodes?
content.html:
Not sure if this is intended:

  1. Click on double pendulum in 3D view and see that 3 nodes are now selected in the SV.

  2. Ctrl + Click on one of the selected nodes in SV and it becomes deselected - I was expecting this to deselect all 3 nodes?

content.raw: It doesn't seem that `unscoped` is used except as a way to find the string position just after the first `::`. I think it would be safer to repeat the search for `::` rather than searching for the result of `UnscopedName()`.
content.html: It doesn't seem that unscoped is used except as a way to find the string position just after the first ::. I think it would be safer to repeat the search for :: rather than searching for the result of UnscopedName().

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Select and align nested models

content.raw:
That would be really nice, but I think it's out of the scope of this PR. We can ticket an issue. 

A broader issue to be discussed is how deeply we want to edit nested models. Ideally, we would be able to go into a model, edit some links, then come back to the top model, maybe "ungroup" a nested model, and so on.
content.html:
That would be really nice, but I think it's out of the scope of this PR. We can ticket an issue.

A broader issue to be discussed is how deeply we want to edit nested models. Ideally, we would be able to go into a model, edit some links, then come back to the top model, maybe "ungroup" a nested model, and so on.
